title: What is this beautiful face
content:
Please enlighten me. Im pretty weak with serif typefaces.

Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [asdf.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406174922/http:/typophile.com/files/asdf.jpg) | 18.29 KB |

 [‹ Lancome font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406174922/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35100 "Go to previous forum topic") [Tech sans used on Si Begg album covers and artwork ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406174922/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35051 "Go to next forum topic")
author: typevolcom

comments.content: I’m thinking it’s [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20080406174922/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/requiem/index.html), but I’m not positive.
Yes, it looks like Requiem to me too.

Somebody needs to let Hollywood know that they can continue to reference classical Roman inscriptions, while retaining all the grandeur and refinement, but not use the same exact font every single poster.
